objectives: Understand the basic syntax and data types in Python
Be able to write simple Python programs using variables, operators, and control structures
Understand the concept of functions and modules in Python

sections.title: Introduction to Python
sections.content: Overview of Python, history, features, and applications. Installing Python and setting up the environment.
activities: Write their first Python program using print function

sections.title: Basic Syntax and Data Types
sections.content: Variables, data types (strings, numbers, booleans), basic operators (arithmetic, comparison, logical), and control structures (if-else, for loops)
activities: Write a program to calculate the area of a rectangle
Write a program to convert Celsius to Fahrenheit

sections.title: Functions and Modules
sections.content: Defining and calling functions, built-in functions (len(), type(), etc.), importing modules (math, random, etc.)
activities: Write a program to calculate the factorial of a number using a function
Write a program to generate a random number between 1 and 100 using the random module

sections.title: Practice Time
sections.content: Students will work on exercises and projects to practice their Python skills
activities: Work on exercises from online resources (e.g. LeetCode, HackerRank)
Work on a small project (e.g. calculator program, game)

assessment: Students will be assessed based on their participation in class, completion of exercises and projects, and a final quiz
resources: Python for Everybody (online course on Coursera)
